info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 7:54PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Columbia County through 830 PM EDT... At 754 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lorenz Park, or over Hudson, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hudson, Chatham, Claverack, Athens, Austerlitz, Philmont, Lorenz Park, Claverack-Red Mills, Ghent, Stockport, Hillsdale, Columbiaville, Greenport Center, Mellenville, Craryville, Rossman, Red Rock, North Hillsdale, Stockport Station and Arnolds Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
